page.title: 18CHADDESDEN PARK
page.content: In the park there are 1021 trees. 135 were there when the park belonged to {Chaddesden Hall.}364 trees were palnted by Derby Corporation when they took over the land. 522 have been planted in recent years. There is a {dawn redwood tree,}descended from seeds brought back from China 200 years ago when the tree was thought to be extinct. The trees are home for squirrels, owls, kestrels and other British birds. A{brook}flows through the park in which children play and make rope swings across from the trees. There are also pitches for football and cricket, a bowling green, tennis courts, pitch and putt course as well as a children's playground and paddling pool. There is a day centre for the elderly, a library and girl guide's meeting room.
